body_html:
The tf.SparseTensor support for shape inference apparently cannot handle the case where the sparse tensor is the input to a function or the output of a tf.data.Iterator. Unfortunately, tf.SparseTensor lacks the equivalent of tf.Tensor.set_shape(), which we use to provide additional shape information when it is available, so this information gets dropped on the floor.

I'll assign this issue to @jsimsa, since he implemented the tf.SparseTensor support in tf.data, but note that he's busy with more important things right now, so I'll also mark it as "contributions welcome" if anybody wants to contribute a fix in the meantime.

body:
The `tf.SparseTensor` support for shape inference apparently cannot handle the case where the sparse tensor is the input to a function or the output of a `tf.data.Iterator`. Unfortunately, `tf.SparseTensor` lacks the equivalent of `tf.Tensor.set_shape()`, which we use to provide additional shape information when it is available, so this information gets dropped on the floor.

I'll assign this issue to @jsimsa, since he implemented the `tf.SparseTensor` support in `tf.data`, but note that he's busy with more important things right now, so I'll also mark it as "contributions welcome" if anybody wants to contribute a fix in the meantime.
